thread.title: Uganda Miss Tourism ambassadors prepare for boot camp
thread.title_full: Uganda Miss Tourism ambassadors prepare for boot camp

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Uganda Miss Tourism ambassadors prepare for boot camp
text:
Uganda Miss Tourism ambassadors prepare for boot camp Adv: 
Aug 05, 2015 Adv: 
Tall and elegant Pauline Akurut 19, of Soroti is now the Miss Tourism Teso region 2015/2016. She was crowned at the last regional Miss Tourism event held at the Trends Club in Soroti Municipality. 
The A Level (High School) graduate beat ten other contestants to take the eastern crown. In second place was Josephine Atipe, 22, who was also crowned Miss Talent. Hope Linda Ateki 23 of Pallisa District came on as second runner up. 
"I am very happy for having been crowned Miss Tourism Teso, I am going to use my position for advertising Teso to the outside world," an ecstatic Akurut said, adding that her passion and zeal is to educate and create awareness about the importance of the tourism industry in Uganda. 
Miss Tourism Teso was the last regional event, before the final on 28 August. The winners of the regional contest will 13 August move into a Boot Camp where they will be trained to in ettiquette, soft skills and tourism. This is to help them become effective tourism ambassadors for both their regions and Uganda.
